Certifyi

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "this record have already been certified"

arguments.value: this record have already been certified

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "this record have already been certified"

nodes.name: certify
exists
getCertifier
getTimestamp
didCertify
isCertifier
ecrecovery
ecverify

certify(bytes32).details: stores address of function caller and blocks timestamp is stored via mapping and emits LogCertified event

didCertify(bytes32).details: checks whether the hash mapped with address equals msg.sender or not
didCertify(bytes32).return: bool value explaining whether the given record certified by function caller or not

ecrecovery(bytes32,bytes).details: Recover signer address from a message by using his signature

params._hash: bytes32 message, the hash is the signed message. What is recovered is the signer address.
params._sig: bytes signature, the signature is generated using web3.eth.sign()

ecrecovery(bytes32,bytes).return: address that generated _sig by siging the hash

ecverify(bytes32,bytes,address).details: checks whether the signer claimed is actually the signer or not

params._hash: bytes32 message, the hash is the signed message.
params._sig: bytes signature, the signature is generated using web3.eth.sign()
params._signer: address of claimed signer of given hash

ecverify(bytes32,bytes,address).return: bool value explaining whether the claimed signer is true or not

exists(bytes32).details: hash the given record and checks if it maps to any address
exists(bytes32).return: bool value explaining whether hash already exists or not

getCertifier(bytes32).details: checks the address mapped with given parameter

getTimestamp(bytes32).details: checks the timestamp mapped with given parameter

isCertifier(bytes32,address).details: checks whether the hash mapped with given record equals given address
isCertifier(bytes32,address).return: bool value explaining whether the given record certified by given address or not

devdoc.author: Manjik Shrestha
devdoc.details: takes bytes32 hash and maps it to the callers address and timestamp
devdoc.title: A Certified Proof Of Existence of Any Document

certify(bytes32).notice: Stores the given hash in Blockchain

didCertify(bytes32).notice: check whether the function caller certify the given record

exists(bytes32).notice: checks if hash already exists on smart contract

getCertifier(bytes32).notice: get the certifier of the Document

getTimestamp(bytes32).notice: get the timestamp when document is certified

isCertifier(bytes32,address).notice: check whether the given address is certifier of given record

userdoc.notice: You can use this contract to store hash of your document on blockchain
